representativeParagraphs.text: Inflation and energy costs have increased component expenses, and ongoing supply chain constraints could reduce margins.
Geopolitical tensions and export controls may limit access to critical suppliers and affect demand in key markets.
Services revenue depends on maintaining subscription levels and platform reliability, and disruptions could impact services.
The pandemic and related travel restrictions led to temporary store closures and reduced in-person service availability.
Remote work arrangements and changing consumer behavior created operational challenges across teams.
Government stimulus effects and sudden demand shifts increased volatility in sales forecasts.
New AI features introduce privacy and security obligations, and regulatory scrutiny may increase compliance costs.
China market demand and export controls remain uncertain and could affect suppliers and production planning.
Subscription growth for services depends on content licensing, competitive pricing, and customer renewal behavior.
Inflation and logistics costs continued to pressure margins, and semiconductor shortage conditions constrained supply.
FX headwinds reduced reported revenue in several regions.
Retail disruption and periodic store closures could reduce in-person sales.
